gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class SceneController

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.SceneController
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, ISceneController, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
AltAzController
public class SceneController
extends ViewControl
implements java.io.Serializable, ISceneController

A SceneController object controls the observers position for one or more 3d panel objects. Derived classes implement various interfaces to allow the user to modify the position.

See Also:
Serialized Form

setCOP

public void setCOP(Vector3D cop)
Set the observer's position (i.e. the Center of Projection ) for this view.

Specified by:
setCOP in interface ISceneController
Parameters:
cop - The new vector to use for the observer's position. THIS MUST BE DIFFERENT FROM THE VRP WHEN THE apply() METHOD IS CALLED.

setVRP

public void setVRP(Vector3D vrp)
Set the point the observer is looking at (i.e. the View Reference Point ) for this view.

Specified by:
setVRP in interface ISceneController
Parameters:
vrp - The new vector to use for the point the observer is looking at. THIS MUST BE DIFFERENT FROM THE COP WHEN THE apply() METHOD IS CALLED.

setVUV

public void setVUV(Vector3D vuv)
Set the direction that is "up" from the observer's point of view (i.e. the View Up Vector ) for this view.

Specified by:
setVUV in interface ISceneController
Parameters:
vuv - The new vector to use for the view up vector. THIS MUST NOT BE IN THE SAME DIRECTION AS THE DIFFERENCE (cop-vrp) WHEN THE apply() METHOD IS CALLED.

setPerspective

public void setPerspective(boolean onoff)
Set whether or not to use a perspective projection, instead of an orthographic projection.

Specified by:

Parameters:

isPerspective

public boolean isPerspective()
Get whether or not to use a perspective projection was selected.

Specified by:
isPerspective in interface ISceneController
Returns:
true if a perspective projection should be used and false if an orthographic projection should be used.
